author: Audrey
text: 'Great pizza. Never regret coming here. What‚Äôs not to love?'

author: Brian Stauffer
text: 'Literally my favorite pizza place on the planet. We get Grimaldi‚Äôs nearly every week
column5: and always take visitors'

author: Joseph Brown
text: "Everything was just average which was disappointing. I went because I witnessed a wonderful pizza delivered to a guest's table a week or so prior to my visit. The pizza I received was not at all close to the amazing pie I had witnessed. Add to this a less than welcoming hostess and a disinterested server  you begin to feel you'd made a terrible mistake. The food runners and bussers were the only ones that delivered excellent customer service."

author: Yoann Bentz
text: "We ordered 7 pizzas for a party. They have a lot of original options
column5: and all the ones we've tried were good!"

author: Elizabeth D'Amato
text: 'Medium-thickness crust pizza that‚Äôs chewy on the inside and perfect crisp on the outside.\n\nOrdered Grimaldi‚Äôs Favorite and Margharita. Both were great. Margharita was the best - tomato sauce was really fresh tasting.'

author: Marina Molinelli
column5: hands down from the family that knows pizza best!'

author: Ron J
text: 'Been here a bunch of times. Great pizza. One of the best Ive had in years.'

author: Victor Delgado
text: "The meals at Grimaldi's Pizzeria are very tasty and the oven brick pizza üçï is one of the best in town. But the staff that they have and are several Latinos
column5: they have no character and the level of attention is absolutely poor."

author: J Lin
text: 'excellent pizza and excellent eggplant parm and spaghetti

author: Mei-Ly Chua
column5: server was not happy and very slow. Our drinks came out right before our food did. They have a full bar but couldn't make any cocktails? She didn't check up on us once."

author: Hansel Cabrera
column5: friendly staff.'

author: Kanika Aggarwal
text: 'We ordered Margherita pizza. The 1st slice of the pizza was quite good but it started becoming cold & soggy really fast
column5: probably due to the sauce. Not a great experience & the chef had no interest in taking a feedback.'

author: Tessa Gerald
column5: nothing to write home about
column6: but it stacks up quickly. The waitress didn't know what some of the flavors on the menu were."

author: eunjoo park
text: 'The best pizza I‚Äôve ever had! You can meet very authentic Italian pizza and find every ingredients are super fresh and savory! Service was good as well!\nWould recommend to everyone who wants the best pizza in town!'

author: Amish Bhavsar
text: 'Great brick over coal fired pizza. The garlic bread pizza is amazing. The prices are reasonable and the service is quick. Will definitely visit them again soon'

author: Amy Hughes
text: 'Pizza was great.  Thin crust. Big pizza slices. Fresh and hot.'

author: Michael Desousa
column5: no reservation needed. Just walked up on a busy Sunday and got a beautiful seat outside right away. The pizza here is always consistent and never fails. This is a Hoboken staple!'

author: RitMan
text: 'Great tasting  pizza üçïüçïüçï.. wish they would deliver to more areas'

author: douglas pearson
text: 'Great pizza great quality ingredients...look forward to going back again....'

author: Tattoo
text: 'Nice place for a slice and drink. Outside dining also available'

author: Shraddha Bansode
text: 'I had a wonderful time here. We had the white pizza and it was truly amazing and freshly made! Even the Cappuccino was delicious. The server was well-spoken and made us feel comfortable.'

author: David Rosensaft
column5: good service.  Haven't tried the pizza

author: Carlos Titos
column5: very fresh. Margarita pizza gets a thumbs up. Easily recommend the Cheese Ravioli and Chocolate Mousse Cup for Dessert. Fast and friendly service. Great atmosphere. Can't go wrong with Grimaldi's."

author: Ileania Lopez
text: 'First time here with a friend. They did not disappoint. Loved their Margherita pizza. Will be back!'

author: Nik
text: 'I was here a few years ago best Hawaiian pineapple pizza in town'

author: Michael S
text: 'Top 3 pizza places in Hoboken and JC'

author: Tina Ahuja
column5: very warm and inviting. The pizza and the spaghetti and meatballs are delicious meals. Definitely recommend!'

author: Paul Bajada
column5: surpasses its reputation'

author: Juan Jose Rodriguez Cruz
text: 'Fast service and tasty food! Traditional Coal oven pizza with a great taste and a perfect crust.'

author: AlexY Rodriguez
column5: Brick oven Pizza
column10: and the house salad is pretty appetizing
column11: Thank you for the great service
column12: they have also added outdoor dining to combat the coronavirus
column13: makes eating there safer and more comfortable'

author: Shakira Santos
text: 'Lovely staff great food! Will be going soon!'

author: Luhily
text: "Went here a while back for a friend's birthday. Pizza wasn't great. Just ate the topping
column5: paid and left."

author: Nicole Feliz
text: 'Good quality and great taste and great quantity
column5: even better in house IPA beer!!!'

author: Julia Chen
text: 'Almost the best Pizza we have ever had! Love it!'

author: Michael Martinez
text: 'One of the best pizzerias in hoboken'

author: Bailey Mariner
text: 'I‚Äôm generally disappointed with Hoboken pizza places
column5: but Grimaldi‚Äôs is one of the best here! Our go to is the Grimaldi‚Äôs favorite- It‚Äôs the crust that makes a good pizza and this place has decent crust! Plus it‚Äôs not too weighted down when you pick up a slice. We always get the buffalo wings here too!'

author: Eric Hammer
text: 'Consider this a retroactive review as I‚Äôve been to Grimaldi‚Äôs a few times over the years. I‚Äôve always left satisfied and maintain that they have some of the better pizza in a city with a ton of options. With regard to specifically sit down pizza spots (in normal times)
column5: Grimaldi‚Äôs is one of the best.'

author: Stephanie Cwynar
text: 'I love this place! I highly recommend getting eggplant and extra garlic on your pizza.\n\nThe ambience
column5: staff
column6: and food are always consistently great!'

author: Jesus Marquez
text: 'Very friendly and a very good pizza'

author: Vi M
column5: on point!!'

author: Karen Ruiz
text: 'The amazing margherita pizza makes me proud to call Jersey my home!!'

author: Jon Friedman
text: 'An Italian institution no doubt real good thin crust full size pies  with fresh toppings.'

author: Austin Song
text:
'Can‚Äôt go wrong with Grimaldi‚Äôs!

There are many pizza places in Hoboken and I still think Grimaldi is one of the better ones.

Had many different pies and margarita is still my favorite.  Pasta is pretty good for kids too.

Grimaldi IPA was NOT good... I highly suggest sticking to bigger brands on tap.'

author: Steve Steinberg
column5: with satisfying crust and tasty cheese and sauce.  It is the sort of pizza that makes you want to eat more.  Lots of choices for additional toppings are available.  Pies come in several sizes.  Good beer choices are offered.  You can order wine
column6: too.  Service is prompt and very knowledgeable.  A special advantage is the large space with plenty of tables.  Feel free to come with a large party.'

author: Deyanira Herrera
column5: we put together the perfect one !'

author: Nancy Ricany
text: 'Small place with tight seating.\nWas a bit disappointed until I had a slice of margherita pie.  It was heavenly
column5: especially with the addition of a dash of salt
column6: pepper and parmesan cheese.\nThe hot house tomatoes did not go well the the mozzarella cheese for the caprese salad. The bread given with the caprese salad was more air holes than bread.\nOver all
column7: We all enjoyed most of the food.\nStaff wasnt very friendly but they tried.'

author: jackeline Renteria
text:
"(Translated by Google) The best pizza we bought two days in a row because we really liked the Brooklyn location and found this one in Hoboken near our hotel and two days in a row was our dinner! It's something from another world! Amazing the taste of pizza! Without a doubt 100% recommended this location is less crowded than that of Brooklyn I think people go more for the other because of the routes that make the famous Brooklyn Bridge but if you are in New Jersey it is the same and is obviously the same flavor !!

(Original)
La mejor pizza compramos dos d√≠as seguidos porque nos gusto mucho la de la locaci√≥n de Brooklyn y encontramos esta en Hoboken cerca de nuestro hotel y dos d√≠as seguidos fue nuestra cena! Es algo de otro mundo!! Incre√≠ble el sabor de la pizza! Sin duda alguna recomendada al 100% esta locaci√≥n esta menos llena que la de Brooklyn yo creo la gente va m√°s para la otra por los recorridos que hacen al famoso Puente de Brooklyn pero si estas en Nueva Jersey es la misma y es obviamente el mismo sabor!!"

author: Luvinder Nijjer
text: 'Quick and attentive service from the staff and the food was tasty.'

author: Barry Weinstein
column5: not great

author: Diana Carvajal
text:
'(Translated by Google) Very little variety of pizzas and there is no vegan or vegetarian option.

(Original)
Muy poca variedad de pizzas y no existe la opci√≥n vegana ni vegetariana.'

author: Kai Chang
text: "A Hoboken institution.  Worth a try if you've never had brick oven."

author: DAVID WEISER
text: 'Excellent pizza - if you are in Hoboken this pizza is SO MUCH better than the pizza found in the suburbs.'

author: Anjali Pradhan
text: "Went with friends as we had heard that this was THE place for pizza. It was ok. I've def had better."

author: nobutoyonakanishi Nakanishi
text:
'(Translated by Google) I enjoyed the exquisite pizza taste of Italian taste and New York taste after a long time.

author: Ankit singh
text: 'didnt even offer a glass of water during the entire  dinner'

author: Michael Rabadi
text: 'Sauce is not very good. Seems like this is a rip off of the real Grimaldi‚Äôs in Brooklyn. Different font
column5: different branding

author: Sandro Mazzola
column5: 30usd for the large one

author: madeleine
text: 'apparently their concept of "plain" pizza is margherita style pizza. regardless
column5: the mozzarella was rubbery and the sauce was not very flavorful.'

author: H.C. Laughlin
text: "Love their pizza.\nWe've ordered for pick up
column5: but honestly fresh is best!"

author: Emily Chow Bluck
text: "We had been hearing a lot about Grimaldi's since we moved to Hoboken
column5: so we thought we'd check it out
column7: after two years. I have to say it does not live up to the hype. The toppings and crust we're good
column8: but the pizza sauce in particular was too watery and bland for my taste. You can get more satisfying pizza from Johnny Pepperoni on 11st street and Park or even at 2 Bros in the city."

author: YJ LEE
text: 'Best pizza i‚Äôve ever had! Also Servants are kind.'

author: Greg Kourosh
column5: just get the pepperoni

author: Matt Plumley
text: 'The pizza was fabulous and the staff was great. Good beer selection.'

author: Cynthia McCann-Rich
column5: sauce

author: Kevin Desai
text: "One of the best pizzas I've eaten in my life. Perfect crust. Great cheese. Tasty sauce. Fresh basil. Couldn't have asked for more. Tiramisu was a bit coffee heavy but great nonetheless."

author: Daniel Winiger
text: 'Expensive but best pizza i had this far'

author: Bhushan Joshi
text: 'The pizzas were okay. Nothing extraordinary. Toronto‚Äôs better.'

author: Ashish Narasimham
text: "Great pizza. Our group got a cheese with olives and a white pizza. I'm not a huge fan of white pizzas but ended up liking this one anyway. I had a small bite of it but mostly ate the cheese; two mediums were just enough for the four of us with one slice to spare. Crispy
column5: slightly thicker crust with a crunch as you bite into it
column6: and good flavor. They were able to get the pizza out to us in under 10 minutes - very nice since we were trying to catch a flight. Couldn't miss some good pizza though!"

author: Chris Brockway
text: 'World famous and lived up to our expectations. Pizza is awesome particularly The Don! Must stop place when visiting Hoboken.'

author: Leah S
text: 'Best pizza ever. Great service. Nice booths.'

author: Steven Stern
text: "Food is always good! It's why we keep going back."

author: Austin Smith
text: 'Awesome pizza. Upstairs room is great space for an event. Staff was really responsive and considerate of our group'

author: Hector Link Vazquez
text: 'Always a satisfying flavorful pizza option. Rich flavor in all of its ingredients. One of the the family favorites.'

author: Robert Dewey
text: "Best pizza place in Hoboken. Coal fired from doesn't disappoint."

author: philip park
text: "The pizza was good but not great imo but taste can be subjective. Service was great and there was no wait during lunchtime so I'll definitely be stopping by again"

author: Ookami Akai
text: 'Staff is amazing and the food is awesome. Portions are more than enough.'

author: Nicole Jala
text: "We've been eating from Grimaldi's for years and it never disappoints!  The pizza is freshly made in front of your eyes (which my kids really enjoyed watching!) and is simply delicious!  The staff is friendly
column5: menu offers a bunch of options including salads and desserts
column6: and prices are reasonable.  There is ample seating inside on multiple levels

author: Tanjela McBride
text: 'Great food! My team and I ordered personal pizzas and Calzones.  Very delicious!'

author: Jorge Pesantes
column5: specifically  the antipasto very delicious'

author: shantanu dutt
text: 'Best place to relax and have a good Italian pizza with your friends if you are in Hoboken. The place maintains its quality the service is quick and the pizzas are just amazing.\nOne thing to know is that this place gets very crowded in weekends so come early to get a place.'

author: Darius Shalforoosh
text: 'Great pizza and $10 off bottles of wine on Wednesday!'

author: Thomas Chaves
text: 'The pizza was delicious- carnivores will like THE DON Pizza. Service was great
column5: but the antipasto was pretty weak. Get a salad or appetizer instead.'

author: Gustavo Bermudez
column5: average salad

author: Sasha Vyshynska
text: "I don't get the 5-star reviews. All the ingredients are tasteless."

author: NoName Game
text: 'Taking off 1 star for the place being a little slow. Food is amazing. Highly suggest trying the white pie with pepperoni.'

author: anandita tyagi
text: 'The Margarita pizza is still as awesome as i remember it from 4 years ago
column5: wonderful crust
column6: tasty sauce. they have moved from the original location. It used to be a cash only place but now they accept cards as well.'

author: Daniel Green
column5: really
column6: 7 stars; slice of Heaven! üòé That's what we had

author: David Summers
text: 'Soggy pizza and warm beer! Also the cooks need to wear gloves during food prep. Wait staff seemed a little disorganized...'

author: Allison Ehrhart
text: "Great pizza and a really fun atmosphere (especially if you go on a night where they have live music!). Pro tip: order the large garlic bread - it's the size of a pizza pie and SO good!!!"

author: S RR
column5: and was told they don\'t deliver to the Hoboken Andrew Jackson Public housing buildings
column7: other than "just because". I would understand if it were in a different town
column8: but I can\'t believe it\'s 2018 and businesses are still profiling certain sectors of the towns they make their money in. Shame I\'ve never tried their pizza
column9: and after today I don\'t have any interest in giving them my money; sticking to Delfinos!'

author: Steve Griffith
text: 'Tried pizza all over NY. This place
column5: I like the best. If I had to choose somewhere to eat every day for the rest of my life: Grimaldi‚Äôs.'

author: kommineni srikanth
text: 'Very rude wait staff and mediocre food'

author: Cara l
text: 'Comfortable restaurant for a group with good food and service'

author: Omar Tabari
text: "Excellent service and the food was really nice. If you're in Hoboken and want a good pizza look no further."

author: Danny Di
text: 'One of the best pizza places outside of Napoli.  Whenever I am in Hoboken I always come by for a pizza.  They use a Coal fired oven which gives the pizza a nice smokiness. The Margherita is my favourite.  But they‚Äôll make it anyway you want.  Just please don‚Äôt ask for pineapple. üëç'

author: Carter Sherwell
text: 'Awesome pizza! I do love the fact that you can watch your pizza being made. Great place for friends and family
column5: great service.'

author: Victoria Pawar
column5: the staff is so helpful and friendly! Great prices too.'

author: Carmen Ortiz
text: 'Pizza is crispy but not over cooked. Fresh mutz..just delicious.'

author: Nick Lenzi
text:
"Grimaldi's is consistently fantastic. Id recommend eating at Grimaldi's as opposed to doing take out or delivery because the cardboard box steams the pizza and takes the crunch out of it. My wife and I love getting a large pie with pepperoni and sausage. Their sausage is so unbelievably delicious.

Also be sure to get their mozerella cakes as an appetizer it will make you wonder why every one doesnt have them on their menu.

My only complaint about this place is that they have RC products instead of Coke or Pepsi."

author: Edward Cooper
text: 'One of the best pizza places in Hoboken.  Also the Mozzarella Cakes are great.'

author: John Cardin
text: 'Best brick oven pizza in the area!!!'

author: Tegh Johar
text: "Great pizza and good atmosphere. It can get crowded on busy days
column5: but that just means it's a good place to eat."

author: Michael Phillips
text: 'Some of the best pizza in Jersey!'

author: Steven Poser
column5: but good and very little cheese. Obnoxious staff that does not honor their parking deal.'

author: Emily Dongyue Zou
column5: definitely recommend'

author: Sriram Velayutham
text: 'Pizza was okish...too salty...Worst buffola chicken wings ...too hard and kind of recooked/heated wings'

author: Tiffany Ann
text: 'we have been here several times for pizza! tends to be a wait around dinner time but they do their best to get everyone seated quickly!'

author: Kenneth Han
column5: great drinks. Don't remember much yay

author: Rohan Shah
text: 'Good pizza place. Cheese ravioli is a must try'

author: Michael Peters
text: 'Tried the mozzarella sticks meatballs and pizza delicious old fashion style'

author: Nathan Noblett
text: "Alright pizza. The gluten free was disappointing. Their sauce doesn't have a lot of spice to it. Barely a step up from tomato sauce from a can."

author: Diana Ceccarini
text: 'Best pizza in hoboken hands down. We go here often and never have any complaints. We also had an welcome family dinner event upstairs before our wedding day. All the out of towners said the pizza was the best they ever had. The staff were great and very attentive to all of our guests. I called ahead and placed the order of everything we wanted to serve. Once we all arrived
column5: the staff brought out all of our food timely.  This made everything so easy and we got to spend time mingling with everyone.'

author: RITI BAHLANI
text: 'Love their thin crust pizzas! Good for big groups! Awesome service'

author: Stan Fernandes
text: "The pizza here is very good. It's a little bit pricey but it's well worth it. The food came out very quickly and it was very hot. The service was very nice and the setting is casual. They don't have much on the menu other than pizza
column5: a few pasta dishes and a few salads. Don't come here expecting a large variety of Italian food. It seems their specialty is pizza and that is what they do best."
